abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Colombia Rural Education
            Project were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the
            risk to development outcome was low or negligible, the Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower performance
            was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: the
            importance of political will, support, and ownership;
            getting the teachers' schools involved; bringing peace
            and coexistence activities into the comprehensive education
            strategy; placing educational institutions at the centre of
            educational change; local stakeholders participating in
            choosing educational models; the essential role of technical
            assistance; getting the private sector involved; and
            mobilizing resources through local governments.
